## Money markets

- The market for short-term borrowing, usually a year or less
- Generally large denomination ($\ge$ $1 million)
- Commonly 3 months or less

. . . 

We will focus on: 
- Treasury Bills
- Repos
- Commercial Paper
- Money Market Mutual Funds
- Shadow Banking System

## Treasury Bills

- Short-term borrowing by the US Government
- Maturity of 1 year or less (1, 3, 6, 12 months)
- Usually issued as discount securities
- Default risk-free 
- Extremely liquid – can convert to cash at low cost/quickly
- Taxes – exempt from state and local income taxes
- Small denomination – can purchase in $100 increments from Treasury Direct
